titlePart.entryReference: designs or pictures characterised by special or unusual light effects, e.g. changing,
disposition of road signs or traffic signals
arrangements or circuits for control of indicating devices using static means to present variable information
static indicating arrangements comprising integral associations of a plurality of light sources , , ,

noteParagraph.text: The term "sign" is used in this sub-class to designate a mark or indication serving to make something recognisable, the information presented being non-varying, even if it is flashing; by way of example it covers, therefore, advertising hoardings, or luminous safety arrangements such as rear reflectors.

titlePart.text: Cardboard or like show-cards of foldable or flexible material
to be erected in three dimensions
wholly or partly imitating the form of an object, e.g. of the article to be advertised
Labels, tag tickets, or similar identification or indication means
to be fastened or secured by the material of the label itself, e.g. by thermo-adhesion
Fastening or securing by means not forming part of the material of the label itself
by pins, staples, or the like
by strings, straps, chains, or wires
Casings, frames, or enclosures for labels
for adjustable, removable, or interchangeable labels

titlePart.entryReference: packages comprising articles attached to cards, sheets, or webs for removal therefrom

titlePart.text: Signs, name or number plates, letters, numerals, or symbols
Signs, plates, panels, or boards using readily-detachable elements bearing or forming symbols
the elements being secured or adapted to be secured by magnetic means
the elements being secured or adapted to be secured by means of pins and holes
the elements being secured or adapted to be secured by means of grooves, rails, or slits
the elements being secured or adapted to be secured by self-adhesion, moisture, suction, slow-drying adhesive, or the like
Constructional features of the symbol-bearing or -forming elements
Letters, numerals, or other symbols, adapted for permanent fixing to a support
Means for attaching signs, plates, panels, or boards to a supporting structure
for rotatably or swingably mounting, e.g. for boards adapted to be rotated by the wind
Indicating arrangements for variable information in which the information is built-up on a support by selection or combination of individual elements
titlePart.entryReference: in which the variable information is permanently attached to a movable support

titlePart.text: in which the desired character or characters are formed by combining individual elements

titlePart.entryReference: incandescent panels comprising a number of separate incandescent bodies, per se
gas discharge panels comprising a number of discharge gaps, per se
semiconductor integrated circuits comprising components adapted for emission of light, per se
liquid crystal panels comprising a number of electrodes in a single cell, per se

titlePart.text: the position of a single light source determining which elements are combined to form the display
in which the desired character is selected from a number of characters arranged one beside the other, e.g. on a common carrier plate
in which the desired character is selected from a number of characters arranged one behind the other
Indicating arrangements for variable information in which the complete information is permanently attached to a movable support which brings it to the display position
titlePart.entryReference: showcases or showcabinets with arrangements for continuously or intermittently moving the merchandise
using static means to present variable information

titlePart.text: the display elements being secured to rotating members, e.g. drums, spindles
the elements being secured to rotating discs
the elements being stiff plates or cards
the display elements being carried by endless belts, chains, or the like
the elements being in the form of stiff flaps, boards, cards, or the like
the display elements being carried by belts, chains, or the like, other than endless
the elements being in the form of stiff flaps, boards, cards, or the like
the advertising or display material forming part of rotating members, e.g. in the form of perforations, prints, or transparencies on a drum or disc
the advertising or display material forming part of a moving band, e.g. in the form of perforations, prints, or transparencies
of a band other than endless
the display elements being fed one by one from a storage place to a display position
the feeding means comprising belts or chains, e.g. endless belts or chains

titlePart.entryReference: control of displays in general using static means to present variable information

titlePart.text: Signs, boards, or panels, illuminated by artificial light sources positioned in front of the insignia
Signs, boards, or panels, illuminated from behind the insignia
using individual cut-out symbols or cut-out silhouettes, e.g. perforated signs
using both translucent and non-translucent layers
using a transparent mirror or other light- reflecting surface transparent to transmitted light whereby a sign, symbol, picture, or other information is visible only when illuminated
Signs formed of, or incorporating, reflecting elements or surfaces, e.g. warning signs having triangular or other geometrical shape
using tubes or the like filled with liquid, e.g. bubbling liquid
Signs formed by electric discharge tubes
with moving light sources, e.g. rotating luminous tubes
with moving optical part or parts, e.g. mirrors
with light sources co-operating with movable members, e.g. with shutters to cover or uncover the light source
titlePart.entryReference: apparatus wherein advertising or display material is moved in a continuous or intermittent succession
construction of details of lighting devices

titlePart.text: with light sources activated by non-visible radiation
titlePart.entryReference: cathode ray image or pattern display tubes
lamps with luminescent screens excited by cathode rays

titlePart.text: Boards, hoardings, pillars, or like structures for notices, placards, posters, or the like
Bills, posters, or the like therefor
Miscellaneous advertising or display means not provided for elsewhere
operated by the opening or closing of doors, e.g. shop door
Dolls, faces, or other representations of living forms with moving parts
Devices demonstrating the action of an article to be advertised

titlePart.entryReference: designs or pictures characterised by special light effects

titlePart.text: displaying different signs depending upon the view-point of the observer
involving the use of optical projection means, e.g. projection of images on clouds
Advertising or display means on roads, walls, or similar surfaces, e.g. illuminated
by a carrier person or animal
by aeroplanes, airships, balloons, or kites
the advertising matter being arranged on the aircraft
the advertising matter being towed by the aircraft
by ships or other floating means
Dispensing devices for pamphlets or similar advertising matter from vehicles
Advertising on or in specific articles, e.g. ashtrays, letter-boxes
titlePart.entryReference: containers, packaging-elements, or packages, with auxiliary means or provisions for displaying articles

titlePart.text: the advertising matter being displayed by the operation of the article
the advertising matter being combined with articles for restaurants, shops, or offices
on paper articles, e.g. booklets, newspapers
on toys, games, puzzles, or similar devices
on clocks, e.g. controlled by the clock mechanism
Combined visual and audible advertising or displaying, e.g. for public address
